content: headband/hairwrap supplies  g/4mm hook  0 50 - 75 oz of cotton medium weight yarn  sewing needle abbreviations chain chain slip_stitch slipstitch single_crochet single_crochet f/o fasten_off standing single_crochet - start with a slip knot on your hook insert your hook into stitch you wish to start in yarn over and pull up a loop yarn over again and pull through both loops on your hook copyright march 2018 page 1 of 3 instructions ties make 2 ch46 starting in the 6th chain from the hook slip_stitch x41 f/o tie the tails in an overhand knot tighten and trim main body note make sure chains are not twisted so that the wrap lies flat and even row 1 in loop of 1st tie work a standing single_crochet ch50 single_crochet in loop of 2nd tie turn row 2 ch10 single_crochet in the 10th chain of previous row x4 ch10 single_crochet in loop turn row 3 ch5 single_crochet in next ch10 space of previous row ch10 single_crochet in next ch10 space x4 ch5 single_crochet in loop turn row 4 ch10 skipping ch5 space single_crochet in next ch10 space of previous row ch10 single_crochet in next ch10 space x3 ch10 skipping ch5 space single_crochet in loop turn row 5 7 & 9 repeat row 3 row 6 8 & 10 repeat row 4 f/o and bring tails through the stitches to the center and knot tightly weave in the tails and trim voila your new headband/hairwrap is complete now just put on your head and tie in a square knot underneath your hair behind head don t you look gorgeous and very retro this pattern and all photos in this document are the property of carrey reynolds @ mixedkreations this pattern is for personal use only no unauthorized reproduction in whole or in part or distribution of this pattern or content is allowed finished products created with this pattern may be sold it is
